suggestions: Consult your physician to discuss the elevated MCH result and potential underlying causes.
Further investigation may be needed to determine the specific reason for high MCH.
Discuss the elevated Urea with your doctor for a comprehensive kidney function assessment.
Ensure adequate hydration by increasing your daily fluid intake.
Review your current medications and dietary habits with your physician, as they can influence Urea levels.
Consult your physician to investigate the cause of the low Hematocrit and potential anemia.
Additional tests, such as a complete iron panel, may be recommended to understand the low Hematocrit.
